# Git push commands (2025-12-19 18:16Z)

_**User**_

what are the git comamdns I use to push my local branch changes to the remote branch

---

_**Agent (model gpt-5.2, mode Agent)**_

### Push your local branch to the remote branch

- **First time pushing this local branch (set upstream):**

```bash
git push -u origin HEAD
```

- **After that (normal push):**

```bash
git push
```

- **If you want to be explicit about branch names:**

```bash
git push -u origin <your-branch-name>   # first time
git push origin <your-branch-name>      # subsequent pushes
```

- **Check what branch youâ€™re on / what it tracks:**

```bash
git status -sb
git branch -vv
```
